TopicTitle: "One Small Step" debrief text is innaccurate when completing the mission with an unmanned vessel.

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.2.0 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Windows 10 Home 64-bit (10.0, Build 19045) | CPU: AMD Ryzen 7 7800X3D 8-Core Processor | GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090 | RAM: 32768MB

 

Severity: Low, kinda immersion-breaking, distracting, but for a few seconds.

Frequency: Medium, whenever you complete this mission with a probe core.

Description: If your first Munar landing is with an unmanned craft, which was the case for me as I like to vaguely recreate human history and in this case was modelling Muna I after 1966's Luna 9, the debrief text in Mission Control is innaccurate because it mentions a crew's observations which of course couldn't occur without a crew. Additionally, the animation after the debrief shows a Kerbonaut landing on the Mun, but I don't expect this to change, as the animation is very much a representation of Kerbal advancement, not supposedly footage from the mission itself*. The text, however, is very explicit in its innaccuracy.

*Although it would be extremely cool if the animation was different for an unmanned completion!
